description: Desktop app for visually building and simulating hardware. Drag-and-drop blocks in a React Flow editor or insert Verilog or Python code snippets, then simulate with Cocotb and Verilator. Like GNU Radio for hardware—design, edit, and verify visually and with code. Includes source blocks to drive designs (noise, sine waves, etc.) and sink blocks to inspect signals interactively in time or frequency domains.

FPGA Designers

Pre-Built Hardware Templates & Examples
Provide a library of at least 50 pre-built hardware blocks (ALU, FIFO, UART, SPI, I2C, etc.) available as drag-and-drop nodes
data.impactInsights: A rich starter library is fundamental to a *visual* hardware IDE: without ready blocks users cannot rapidly prototype. Directly supports the core value-prop of “assemble blocks visually like GNU Radio.”

data.label: Maintain automatic synchronization between visual block and equivalent Verilog/Python code snippet for every template
data.impactInsights: Bi-directional sync between diagram and code is mission-critical; it underpins the promise of combining *visual* and *text* flows and avoids drift bugs.

data.label: Include Cocotb test benches for each template achieving ≥95% code coverage and passing all simulations
data.impactInsights: High-coverage tests improve trust and demo value, but the tool can still function without shipping every template at 95 %.

data.label: Apply semantic versioning with changelogs to every template release in the catalog
data.impactInsights: Good for long-term maintenance and reproducibility yet not a hard blocker for initial usability.

data.label: Enable catalog search and filter operations to return results within 100 ms for 95th percentile queries
data.impactInsights: Fast discovery of blocks critically affects day-to-day flow; sluggish search breaks productivity.

data.label: Allow users to clone, edit, and save custom versions of templates to personal or shared libraries via single-click action
data.impactInsights: Customization encourages reuse and collaboration—high utility though not absolutely core to first MVP.

data.label: Auto-generate schematic, timing diagram, and integration examples for each template and display within documentation panel
data.impactInsights: Quality docs are important for adoption but can be delivered incrementally; not a core simulation/design capability.

data.label: Ensure all templates synthesize without errors on latest Xilinx Vivado and Intel Quartus toolchains
data.impactInsights: Guarantees blocks work beyond simulation; key for users targeting real hardware.

data.label: Drag-and-Drop Block Placement with Snap-to-Grid & Port Auto-Align
data.impactInsights: Core UX mechanic; directly delivers the ‘visual assembly’ promise.

data.label: Library of ≥100 Parameterisable Blocks Searchable in ≤200 ms
data.impactInsights: Scales the visual approach; search speed ties to usability for larger catalogs.

data.label: Embedded Verilog or Python Code-Snippet Nodes with Syntax Highlighting & Linting
data.impactInsights: Text nodes bridge custom logic into the visual graph—central to the hybrid ‘visual + code’ concept.

data.label: Real-Time Connection Validation Flagging Width/Type Mismatches in <1 s
data.impactInsights: Immediate feedback prevents simulation failures; matching the user expectation of modern schematic editors.

data.label: One-Click Git Integration Exporting Diagram JSON & Netlist
data.impactInsights: Hardware teams rely on Git; seamless export is high value for collaboration and CI, though not a core editor function.

data.label: Export Full Diagram to Synthesizable Verilog Netlist in <10 s for ≤500 Blocks
data.impactInsights: Without correct Verilog export the tool cannot feed downstream flows; absolutely fundamental.

data.label: Undo/Redo History Supporting ≥50 Consecutive Actions
data.impactInsights: Standard productivity feature; users expect safe exploration. Absence leads to frustration.

data.label: Smooth Zoom & Pan at 60 fps with Diagrams up to 1 000 Nodes
data.impactInsights: Performance at scale affects perceived quality and determines whether serious projects are feasible.

data.label: Support embedding and executing Verilog (IEEE-1364-2005) and Python 3.10 code within a Code Snippet Node.
data.impactInsights: Language support defines what designs users can express; mandatory to hit target audience.

data.label: Provide syntax highlighting, bracket matching, and code folding for Verilog and Python with visual update latency < 100 ms per keystroke.
data.impactInsights: Improves coding efficiency and reduces errors; expected IDE baseline.

data.label: Perform real-time syntax and lint checks on code and surface errors/warnings within 500 ms after user stops typing.
data.impactInsights: Early error detection saves debug time; competitive IDEs include it.

data.label: Automatically infer I/O ports from the snippet and create corresponding node pins within 1 s after save.
data.impactInsights: Bridges text and visual worlds, removing manual pin mapping—significant UX win.

data.label: Compile Verilog snippets with Verilator and co-simulate Python test benches via Cocotb, achieving build-plus-run time < 10 s for a 1 k-line design on reference hardware.
data.impactInsights: Simulation loop is the verification backbone; speed target ensures interactive workflow.

data.label: Store every save of a Code Snippet Node in an internal Git repository and allow history view & revert in ≤ 3 clicks.
data.impactInsights: Protects against code loss and supports experimentation; aligns with software-style workflows.

data.label: Allow adding a Code Snippet Node to a shared project library that is searchable by name/tags with retrieval time < 2 s.
data.impactInsights: Nice for collaboration but not vital for initial single-user success.

data.label: Run unmodified Cocotb Python testbenches on assembled designs and report pass/fail within the IDE
data.impactInsights: Directly matches product description; elevates verification experience and differentiates from pure schematic tools.

data.label: Compile Verilog/SystemVerilog blocks with Verilator supporting ≥95% of IEEE-1800-2017 features used in the reference suite
data.impactInsights: High language coverage broadens design applicability; important though slightly less critical than basic compile.

data.label: Simulate a 10 k-gate design at ≥1 000 cycles/sec on an 8-core 3 GHz CPU
data.impactInsights: Usable performance threshold for non-trivial designs; slow sims would negate tool benefits.

data.label: Export full-signal VCD/FSDB waveforms with <1 % runtime overhead
data.impactInsights: Waveforms are essential for debug; low overhead keeps performance acceptable.

data.label: Provide UI breakpoints & single-step debugging for both Cocotb code and Verilator simulation
data.impactInsights: Integrated debug shortens iteration cycles, raising user satisfaction; not strictly required for first usable build.

data.label: Offer a CLI to run Cocotb+Verilator simulations headlessly, returning non-zero exit code on failure
data.impactInsights: Important for automation/CI adoption but core desktop use can function without it.

data.label: Exported Verilog must pass Verilator and Yosys linting on designs up to 100 k gates without manual edits.
data.impactInsights: Ensures downstream tool acceptance, preventing costly manual clean-ups.

data.label: Provide VHDL-2008 export that compiles with GHDL and ModelSim with zero syntax errors.
data.impactInsights: Expands market to VHDL users, yet not necessary for Verilog-focused MVP.

data.label: Generate IP-XACT 1.6 compliant component XML validated against official schema.
data.impactInsights: Niche integration format; valuable for enterprise flows but low impact for majority of prototyping users.

data.label: Produce a build-ready Xilinx Vivado project (.xpr) that synthesizes to bitstream in one click.
data.impactInsights: Key for FPGA deployment which is a primary hardware target; high value.

data.label: Produce an Intel Quartus Prime project (.qpf/.qsf) that compiles to SRAM bitstream with default settings.
data.impactInsights: Adds vendor breadth; nice but less critical if Vivado supported first.

data.label: Generate Synopsys Design Compiler TCL script enabling gate-level netlist generation with zero manual edits.
data.impactInsights: Applies to ASIC flows; useful for small subset of users, not central to desktop prototyping vision.

data.label: Auto-generate Cocotb Python testbench skeleton covering all top-level I/Os with ready Makefile.
data.impactInsights: Speeds verification kick-off but users could write tests manually.

data.label: Create portable GNU Makefile for open-source Verilator simulation completing build in < 2 min for 50 k gate design.
data.impactInsights: Aids automation yet overlaps with in-IDE run; moderate impact.

data.label: Export Dockerfile containing toolchain dependencies to run synthesis & simulation in CI within ≤ 10 min.
data.impactInsights: Good for DevOps; peripheral to core desktop editing experience.

data.label: Provide LCOV/HTML code-coverage report generation for simulated RTL with ≥ 95 % statement coverage threshold.
data.impactInsights: Improves quality metrics but advanced users can integrate external tools.

data.label: Stable, SemVer-based Plugin API v1.0 with 18-month backward-compatibility window and automated regression tests across two minor releases.
data.impactInsights: Extensibility matters long-term; not essential for initial product viability.

data.label: Plugins must run in isolated WebWorker/Node-VM sandbox, blocking file-system or network access outside project scope and passing OWASP Top-10 security scans.
data.impactInsights: Security for plugins is important but only after a plugin ecosystem exists.

data.label: Install, enable, disable, or uninstall any plugin without application restart; load time <2 s for a 5 MB plugin on reference laptop.
data.impactInsights: Convenience for plugin users; secondary to main design/sim features.

data.label: Provide fully-typed TypeScript/Python SDK, template repo, and step-by-step docs enabling a new developer to publish a ‘Hello-World’ plugin in ≤30 minutes (usability study n=10).
data.impactInsights: Developer onboarding drives ecosystem growth but not pivotal to core user flow initially.

data.label: Built-in marketplace UI supporting search (<300 ms over 1 000 entries), ratings, and one-click install/update workflows.
data.impactInsights: Helps discovery of plugins; useful after plugin base exists.

data.label: Offer CLI & GitHub Action that runs Verilator+Cocotb regression on each plugin; ≥95 % of registry plugins must pass nightly CI.
data.impactInsights: Quality gate for plugins; advanced ecosystem feature.

data.label: Automated SPDX license scanner warns when plugin license conflicts with MIT/GPL core; ≥95 % detection accuracy on curated 200-plugin corpus.
data.impactInsights: Legal safeguard; low impact on daily design/sim workflow.

data.label: Support saving & retrieving designs to a Git-compatible cloud repository with full commit history and branch / pull-request workflow.
data.impactInsights: Team collaboration and history are crucial for serious projects; aligns with software expectations.

data.label: Provide role-based read, write, and admin permissions per project, enforceable via UI and API, with changes propagated within 5 s.
data.impactInsights: Important for enterprise/team scenarios but not for solo users.

data.label: Index all IP blocks with metadata (name, language, IO spec, license, tags) and return search results in <200 ms for 90 % of queries.
data.impactInsights: Extends reuse across projects; helpful yet secondary to core block library.

data.label: Allow users to publish selected IP blocks to public or private libraries with explicit license selection and visibility settings.
data.impactInsights: Drives community sharing; good for network effects, not core for initial product.

data.label: Enable multi-user commenting and node annotations that synchronize across clients with <1 s latency.
data.impactInsights: Collaboration nicety; tool remains valuable without it.

data.label: Detect concurrent edit conflicts and present a visual diff/merge tool that resolves and saves merged design within 2 min.
data.impactInsights: Critical for multi-user editing but not required for single-user adoption.

data.label: Automatically generate an HTML/PDF report listing all imported IP blocks, versions, authors, and licenses on demand in <10 s.
data.impactInsights: Compliance/reporting utility; marginal to core workflow.

data.label: Lock each referenced IP block to a specific semantic version and guarantee simulations reproduce identical results regardless of later library updates.
data.impactInsights: Reproducibility is important especially for CI; moderate impact.

data.label: Provide a guided walkthrough mode that highlights relevant UI elements and nodes with instructional overlays for each tutorial step
data.impactInsights: Onboarding aid; improves learning curve but not functionality.

data.label: Include at least 20 built-in tutorial lessons covering basic gates through pipelined processors, accessible from a Tutorials library panel
data.impactInsights: Education drives adoption, especially for new users/students; valuable though not functional necessity.

data.label: Persist per-user tutorial progress (Not Started / In-Progress / Completed) across sessions using local storage or cloud sync
data.impactInsights: Nice UX detail for learning; low effect on design capabilities.

data.label: Automatically run simulation after each tutorial step and display results within 2 seconds for designs up to 500 logic elements
data.impactInsights: Reinforces learning and showcases core sim loop; moderate impact.

data.label: Embed code challenge checkpoints that execute user-entered Verilog or Python snippets and return pass/fail feedback within 3 seconds
data.impactInsights: Gamified learning element; useful for tutorials, not core tooling.

data.label: Offer on-demand context-sensitive hints for each tutorial step, revealed in no more than 3 clicks and logged for analytics
data.impactInsights: Further tutorial polish; limited impact on main feature set.

data.label: Allow users to reset the tutorial workspace to its initial state in one click and undo the last 20 actions
data.impactInsights: Quality-of-life for training; small scope relative to product’s primary value.

data.label: V1 - MVP
V2 - Performance & Scalability Improvements
V3 - Production-Ready Export Tooling
V4 - Plugin Ecosystem & Marketplace
V5 - Collaboration & Tutorials Expansion
V6 - Improvements
Box Select & Multi-Select Grouping with Align/Distribute Executing in ≤200 ms for 50 Blocks
data.impactInsights:
**Why it matters** 
• Core daily‐use editing flow; slow or missing grouping/align makes large designs painful. 
• Directly drives perceived usability of the visual editor, a primary product differentiator. 

**Why not 5** 
• Work-arounds (manual drag) exist, so failure degrades UX but does not block all use.

data.label: Create, Collapse, and Re-open Hierarchical Sub-Diagrams of 100 Blocks in ≤1 s while Preserving Netlist Hierarchy
data.impactInsights:
**Why it matters** 
• Essential for scaling beyond toy examples; without hierarchy, diagrams become unmanageable. 
• Impacts both correctness (netlist scope) and UX (visual clutter). 
• Competitors like GNU Radio provide this; absence would be a strategic gap.

data.label: Parameter Inspector Panel Opens in ≤100 ms and Applies Changes to Running Simulation in <1 s
data.impactInsights:
**Why it matters** 
• Real-time param tweaking is key to an interactive HW sandbox. 
• Directly ties editor to simulator; slow feedback kills exploratory flow. 
• Any delay here propagates to every design iteration.

data.label: Auto-Route 90° Orthogonal Connections for up to 100 Nets in ≤500 ms with ≤5 Overlaps
data.impactInsights:
**Why it matters** 
• Reduces diagram clutter and manual wiring effort, improving readability. 
• Speeds initial prototyping, a core product promise. 

**Why not 5** 
• Users can still draw wires manually; it’s a productivity boost, not a blocker.

data.label: Automatic Diagram Autosave Every 30 s with Session Recovery Loading in ≤3 s
data.impactInsights:
**Why it matters** 
• Protects user work from crashes/power loss; trust & reliability issue. 
• Industry-standard expectation; absence would be viewed as negligence.

data.label: Enable parameterized templates: Editing parameters in properties panel regenerates HDL & updates block within 500 ms for 95th percentile interactions
data.impactInsights:
**Why it matters** 
• Makes template library truly reusable; fixed-param blocks limit value. 
• Tight regeneration time keeps interactive feel. 

**Why not 5** 
• Users could clone & edit code manually, though far less convenient.

data.label: Attach SPDX license identifier and author metadata to every template and surface in catalog details view
data.impactInsights:
**Why it matters** 
• Clarifies legal usage, easing enterprise adoption. 

**Why low** 
• Does not affect core design/simulation flow; mostly compliance.

data.label: Run nightly CI pipeline executing Verilator+Cocotb simulations for all templates, completing under 10 minutes with 0 failures
data.impactInsights:
**Why it matters** 
• Ensures shipped templates stay functional; reduces support load. 
• Builds credibility of catalog. 

**Why not higher** 
• Users can still work even if CI occasionally fails; indirect impact.

data.label: Generate port documentation table listing direction, width, and purpose for 100 % of template ports
data.impactInsights:
**Why it matters** 
• Aids learnability and integration. 

**Why low** 
• Documentation improves UX but does not unlock functionality.

data.label: Provide at least 20 reusable source/sink templates (e.g., noise, sine, spectrum analyzer) for signal generation and inspection
data.impactInsights:
**Why it matters** 
• Out-of-box library sets initial user value; fewer blocks = empty toolbox. 
• Differentiates product similar to GNU Radio’s block set. 

**Why not 5** 
• Users can create custom blocks, though with higher barrier.

data.label: Offer context-aware auto-completion and signature help for Verilog system tasks/functions and Python 3.10 standard library symbols with response time ≤ 200 ms per keystroke.
data.impactInsights:
**Why it matters** 
• Speeds code entry, reduces syntax errors—critical for mixed visual/code workflow. 
• Competing IDEs provide it; missing feature hurts perceived polish. 

**Why not 5** 
• Power users can work without it; core simulation unaffected.

data.label: Execute Python snippets in a restricted sandbox limiting file-system access to the project directory, capping CPU time to 2 s per run, and preventing network calls.
data.impactInsights:
**Why it matters** 
• Prevents malicious or runaway code; protects user machine and corporate environments. 
• Enables safe sharing of designs. 

**Why not 5** 
• Desktop app (not cloud) less exposed, though still important.

data.label: Display inline documentation tool-tips for Verilog keywords, Python built-ins, and user-defined symbols on hover with latency ≤ 100 ms.
data.impactInsights:
**Why it matters** 
• Lowers learning curve; complements autocomplete. 

**Why not higher** 
• Convenience feature; absence doesn’t block workflow.

data.label: Enable users to mark snippet pins as probes that automatically stream to oscilloscope/spectrum sink blocks at ≥ 20 fps for up to 1 024 signals.
data.impactInsights:
**Why it matters** 
• Real-time signal visibility is a marquee feature similar to on-chip debug. 
• Deeply integrates code & visual sinks; drives "simulate & inspect" value prop. 
• Performance target ensures smooth UX.

data.label: Allow definition of editable parameters/constants in a snippet’s property panel and regenerate code/ports within 500 ms after any parameter change.
data.impactInsights:
**Why it matters** 
• Mirrors param templates but for ad-hoc code; empowers iterative design. 
• Keeps code and diagram in sync. 

**Why not 5** 
• Users can still edit code directly; workflow just less streamlined.

data.label: Export SystemVerilog-2017 that compiles without warnings on Synopsys VCS and Mentor Questa for designs up to 200 k gates.
data.impactInsights:
**Why it matters** 
• Bridges from exploratory prototyping to production tool-chains; critical for professional adoption. 
• Compilation warnings erode trust; clean export is table stakes.

data.label: Generate Xilinx Design Constraints (.xdc) with pin and timing constraints yielding zero unmet constraints in Vivado timing analysis on reference board.
data.impactInsights:
**Why it matters** 
• Enables FPGA implementation flow, a major use case. 
• Reduces manual constraint editing errors. 

**Why not 5** 
• Applies only to Xilinx users; others unaffected.

data.label: Produce Synopsys Design Constraints (.sdc) capturing clocks, IO, and false-path definitions achieving ≤ 5 % timing slack deviation post-synthesis in Design Compiler.
data.impactInsights:
**Why it matters** 
• Critical for ASIC flow; ensures timing intent preserved. 

**Why not 5** 
• High-end niche; hobbyists might not care.

data.label: Auto-generate CMSIS-SVD 1.3 compliant XML and corresponding C header/driver for memory-mapped registers compiling cleanly with GCC -Wall -Werror.
data.impactInsights:
**Why it matters** 
• Smooths firmware/hardware hand-off; valuable for SoC use. 

**Why not higher** 
• Not every design involves memory-mapped registers.

data.label: Output GitHub Actions workflow YAML that builds Verilator simulation, runs Cocotb tests, and uploads coverage in ≤ 15 min CI job.
data.impactInsights:
**Why it matters** 
• Promotes best practices; lowers friction to adopt CI. 

**Why not higher** 
• Users can craft workflows themselves; convenience feature.

data.label: Generate UVM 1.2 SystemVerilog testbench skeleton instantiating DUT, basic sequence, compiling in Questa with -uvm flag.
data.impactInsights:
**Why it matters** 
• Helps advanced verification teams. 

**Why low** 
• Specialized; many users will ignore it.

data.label: Each plugin must include a manifest (plugin.json) conforming to schema v1.1 containing name, version, description, author, license, entrypoints, and minAppVersion; provided CLI linter must report zero errors.
data.impactInsights:
**Why it matters** 
• Ensures plugin ecosystem stability and discoverability. 

**Why not higher** 
• Core app functions without plugins; impact indirect.

data.label: Plugin build pipeline must produce byte-identical artifacts (SHA-256 match) across two consecutive CI runs; non-determinism allowance <0.1 % file diff.
data.impactInsights:
**Why it matters** 
• Supports security and reproducibility. 

**Why low** 
• Failure doesn’t impede day-to-day design/simulate cycle.

data.label: Enabling a plugin in a 50-block reference design shall not increase simulation wall-clock time by >5 % or RAM usage by >100 MB on the baseline laptop (Intel i7-1185G7, 16 GB RAM).
data.impactInsights:
**Why it matters** 
• Guards baseline performance; poor isolation would tarnish user perception. 

**Why not higher** 
• Only relevant when plugins installed; core still works.

data.label: All user-visible strings in a plugin must be externalized via the app’s i18n API; at minimum, English and one additional locale file must be supplied; l10n linter score ≥95 %.
data.impactInsights:
**Why it matters** 
• Broadens market reach; ensures consistent UX. 

**Why low** 
• Does not affect functionality for English-speaking users, which may be majority early adopters.

data.label: Plugin distribution bundle must embed an SPDX v2.3 SBOM listing 100 % third-party dependencies; SBOM validation in CI must pass with zero critical issues.
data.impactInsights:
**Why it matters** 
• Aids security/compliance audits, important for enterprise. 

**Why low** 
• Indirect effect on day-to-day user value.

data.label: Simulate mixed Verilog/SystemVerilog and VHDL modules via VHPI bridge with 100 % signal visibility and ≤2 % performance degradation compared to Verilog-only designs
data.impactInsights:
**Why it matters** 
• Many legacy IPs in VHDL; mixed-lang ability widens adoption base. 

**Why not 5** 
• Some users are Verilog-only; complexity could delay releases.

data.label: Achieve ≥1.8× simulation speedup when increasing CPU cores from 4 to 8 on a 50 k-gate reference design
data.impactInsights:
**Why it matters** 
• Performance is a selling point vs. commercial simulators. 
• Directly impacts productivity on large designs. 

**Why not 5** 
• Benefit felt mainly on bigger CPUs/designs; small projects unaffected.

data.label: Execute ≥500 parameterized Cocotb testcases in overnight batch mode, producing aggregated JUnit XML and coverage reports
data.impactInsights:
**Why it matters** 
• Supports serious verification workflows. 

**Why not higher** 
• Overnight regression is important but not interactive; niche for hobbyists.

data.label: Automatically record random seeds for every Cocotb run and enable deterministic replay that produces identical pass/fail results
data.impactInsights:
**Why it matters** 
• Key for debugging and CI triage; flakiness erodes trust. 

**Why not 5** 
• Applies primarily to randomized tests; some designs deterministic.

data.label: Link SystemVerilog DPI-C models compiled with GCC/Clang into Verilator simulation and call them from Cocotb with <5 % function-call overhead
data.impactInsights:
**Why it matters** 
• Enables high-performance C models; valuable for certain IP. 

**Why not higher** 
• Advanced use case; average user may not need DPI-C.

data.label: Adapt subsequent tutorial steps based on user error history, selecting the appropriate difficulty branch within 100 ms of step completion
data.impactInsights:
**Why it matters** 
• Improves onboarding and learning retention. 

**Why low** 
• Core product usable without adaptive tutorials.

data.label: Provide complete localization of tutorial UI and content in English, Spanish, and Simplified Chinese, with language switch achievable from settings in ≤3 clicks
data.impactInsights:
**Why it matters** 
• Expands global reach. 

**Why low** 
• Affects only tutorial content; product still functions.

data.label: Ensure all tutorial controls (next, previous, hint, reset) are operable via keyboard shortcuts and meet WCAG 2.1 AA for focus indication
data.impactInsights:
**Why it matters** 
• Accessibility compliance broadens audience and avoids legal issues. 

**Why not higher** 
• Limited to tutorial area; main editor already keyboard-driven.

data.label: Generate a branded PDF certificate summarizing completed lessons within 5 s of tutorial completion
data.impactInsights:
**Why it matters** 
• Nice-to-have for educational marketing. 

**Why low** 
• No influence on design or simulation capability.

data.label: Autosave tutorial workspace and code every 30 s or on checkpoint pass and restore the last state within 3 s after application relaunch
data.impactInsights:
**Why it matters** 
• Prevents frustration during learning; consistent with diagram autosave. 

**Why not higher** 
• Scope limited to tutorial; core projects already covered by global autosave.
